p: A total of 684 (69%) patients were admitted to Oulu University Hospital, the mean duration of hospitalization being 4.2 days (SD 5.4) in the intervention group and 4.1 days (SD 4.9; difference 0.1, 95% CI –0.5 to 0.6) in the control group ( Table 3 ). The mean duration of antibiotic treatment in all study patients within 1 month was 11.3 days (SD 12.6) in the intervention group and 10.4 days (SD 11.4) in the control group (difference 0.9, 95% CI –0.6 to 2.4). There was no statistically significant difference between the groups. Antibiotic consumption in mean defined daily doses was 0.38 (SD 0.42) per day in the intervention group and 0.35 (SD 0.38) per day in the control group (difference 0.03, 95% CI –0.02 to 0.80). A total of 317/496 patients (64%) in the intervention group and 322/502 (64%) in the control group received antimicrobial treatment during the 30-day period ( Fig. 2 ). During the first 7 days, 61% (609/998) of the patients in both groups received antibiotic treatment ( Table 3).
